description:
The story of the anime revolves around Dandy, an alien-hunter. His job is to seek out new aliens never seen before, and receives a reward whenever he finds a new species. His mission is to find those new species faster than anyone else as he travels the galaxy. Together with the bucket-of-bolts robot QT and the dimwit alien Meow he picked up along the way, he comes into contact with new planets and their inhabitants..

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Space
tags.description: Partly or completely set in outer space.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Space Opera
tags.description: Centers around space warfare, advanced technology, chivalric romance and adventure.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Achronological Order
tags.description: Chapters or episodes do not occur in chronological order.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Zombie
tags.description: Prominently features reanimated corpses which often prey on live humans and turn them into zombies.

tags.name: Surfing
tags.description: Centers around surfing as a sport.

tags.name: Mixed Gender Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several people, regardless of gender, who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Yuri
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two females, not inherently sexual. Also known as Girls' Love.

title.native: スペース☆ダンディ ピクチャードラマ

node.description:
Most known for directing critically and commercially successful series, [Cowboy Bebop](https://anilist.co/anime/1/) and [Samurai Champloo](https://anilist.co/anime/205/).

He is noted for blending together multiple genres in his anime. For example, in Cowboy Bebop, classic cowboy western mixes with '60s/'70s New York City film noir, jazz/blues music, Hong Kong action movies, and to top it off the series is set in space. In his later work, Samurai Champloo, he unites the cultures of Okinawa, hip hop, modern-day Japan, and chanbara.
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/佐藤大)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/信本敬子)

Nobumoto made her debut as a scriptwriter in 1989 on TV drama, and on anime two years later with [Fly! Peek the Whale](https://anilist.co/anime/2314/).

Widely known for her work on hit titles such as [Cowboy Bebop](https://anilist.co/anime/1/), [Tokyo Godfathers](https://anilist.co/anime/759/) and [Macross Plus](https://anilist.co/anime/474/). She is noted as the original creator of [Wolf’s Rain](https://anilist.co/anime/202/). She also contributed scripts for [Samurai Champloo](https://anilist.co/anime/205/), [Space Dandy](https://anilist.co/anime/20057/) and [Carole & Tuesday](https://anilist.co/anime/101281/).

She passed away on December 1, 2021 after a battle with esophageal cancer.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yoshi_u)

Originating from [Tezuka Productions](https://anilist.co/studio/200/). Currently freelance, but often works for [Bones](https://anilist.co/studio/4/).

Notable works as a character designer include [Fullmetal Alchemist](https://anilist.co/anime/121/), [Soul Eater](https://anilist.co/anime/3588/) and [Space Dandy](https://anilist.co/anime/20057/).
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/うえのきみこ)

Originating from [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/). Went through [Gonzo](https://anilist.co/studio/3/) and [Shin-Ei](https://anilist.co/studio/247/) before going freelance. He is most known for his work on the first season of [One Punch Man](https://anilist.co/anime/21087/OnePunch-Man/). He is also the original creator of original anime [Sonny Boy](https://anilist.co/anime/132126/Sonny-Boy/).

__[Website](http://okamurayasuyuki.info/info/profile/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yasuyuki_info/)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/%E5%B2%A1%E6%9D%91%E9%9D%96%E5%B9%B8-%E5%85%AC%E5%BC%8F%E3%82%B5%E3%82%A4%E3%83%88-221960977820152/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/yasuyukiINFO)__

__Birthplace:__ Kobe, Hyogo Prefecture, Japan

__Introduction:__
Yasuyuki Okamura, alternatively known by his pen name Eitarou Isono is a Japanese singer-songwriter, model and music producer who is active in the Japanese music market. He began his professional career in 1985, and is internationally known for the _[City Hunter 2](https://anilist.co/anime/1471/City-Hunter-2)_ ending theme '[Super Girl](https://anidb.net/song/30791)', and for the _[Space Dandy](https://anilist.co/anime/20057/SpaceDandy)_ opening theme '[Viva Namida](https://anidb.net/song/64362)'.

__Biography:__
Yasuyuki was born in Kobe, Hyogo Prefecture, Japan in 1965, he is the oldest of two children. His father worked for Air France, and as a result, his family moved frequently throughout Japan, resulting in him rotating between seven elementary schools and junior high schools. He attended Niigata Higashi High School and formed his first band there, but dropped out in the 11th grade to pursue a musical career while working part-time at the nightclub Hacoban. after sending out numerous demo tapes, and doing composing work for other artists, he was finally signed by Epic Sony in 1986.

Yasuyuki was highly successful in the late 1980s and the early 1990s, first promoted to the world as a teen idol. He also claimed that during this time he was most inspired by the singers [Seiko Matsuda](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Seiko_Matsuda) and [Prince](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prince_(musician)). He starred in the film _Peach I'll Do Anything For You_ (Peach-どんなことをしてほしいのぼくに) alongside Kahori Fujii and Kazuhiko Kanayama. In 1996, he fell back from the media and performing in general, and started to focus more on producing other artists, including Meg and Chara.

Yasuyuki was arrested in 2003 for possession of stimulant drugs, but released after pleading that the drugs were a necessary medicine. His record contract with Epic Sony was terminated by the company, and he was later signed by Universal. In April 2005, he was arrested again, but this time for attempting to use cocaine in a Shibuya record store bathroom, and for this he was sentenced to two years in prison. When returning in 2007, he started a comeback visually similar to his 1980s look, but was arrested again on February 5, 2008 for possession of crystal meth. He was sentenced to another two years in prison, and he then proceeded to return live in Tokyo in 2010. He began releasing demos on his official Myspace page, back then.

In 2011, Yasuyuki begun an official tour again and released a two-part self cover album. Etiquette Pink and Etiquette Purple. He returned to producing other artists and touring, and begun to speak openly about becoming fully sober. In 2013, he released his first single in six years, titled '[Viva Namida](https://anidb.net/song/64362)', which was revealed to become the opening theme to the Shinichiro Watanabe's _[Space Dandy](https://anilist.co/anime/20057/SpaceDandy/staff)_. In the music video for this single, an anime version of Yasuyuki dances and sings along with the Space Dandy cast. In 2014 he toured Japan.

In 2017, he alongside [TeddyLoid](https://anilist.co/staff/130673/TeddyLoid), [Kenshi Yonezu](https://anilist.co/staff/126835/Kenshi-Yonezu) and [DAOKO](https://anilist.co/staff/123235/DAOKO) released a 14 track album titled "[Thank You Blue](https://anidb.net/collection/11407)", featuring the ending theme song from [Takayanagi Shigehito](https://anilist.co/staff/105553)'s directed [Kekkai Sensen & Beyond](https://anilist.co/anime/97886/Kekkai-Sensen--BEYOND/) titled '[Step Up Love](https://anidb.net/song/93942)'.

(Source: [en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yasuyuki_Okamura))

__[Official Website](http://yakushimaruetsuko.com/)__ | __[Profile](http://yakushimaruetsuko.com/category/profile)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mirairecords)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/mirairecords/)__

__Etsuko Yakushimaru__, alternatively known as Tika Alpha when writing lyrics and doing composition, is a Japanese singer, producer, composer, lyricist, arranger, artist, who is also a member and lead vocalist for the band [Soutaisei Riron](https://anilist.co/staff/152353/) (相対性理論).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/e8144) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/eunyoung_tokyo)

Eun-Yeong Choi is an animator, director and producer. Since 2020, she is the President and CEO of the animation studio [Science SARU](https://anilist.co/studio/6145/), which she co-founded with [Masaaki Yuasa](https://anilist.co/staff/100068/) in 2013. A frequent collaborator with Yuasa, she has been involved in all of his projects since _[Kemonozume](https://anilist.co/anime/1454/)_ (2006).

Choi began her career as an animator on shows such as _[Witchblade](https://anilist.co/anime/935/)_, _[Black Lagoon](https://anilist.co/anime/889/)_ and _Kemonozume_ (all 2006). She made her directorial debut in 2008 on episodes of _[Kaiba](https://anilist.co/anime/3701/)_, and later worked as assistant director on _[Kick-Heart](https://anilist.co/anime/16149/)_ (2013). Choi transitioned to producer in 2017, beginning with _[The Night Is Short, Walk On Girl](https://anilist.co/anime/97917/)_. In 2021, she returned to directing, helming an episode of _Star Wars: Visions_.

_Note: Not to be confused with the [writer](https://anilist.co/staff/249891) or the younger [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/283043)._

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ichirou_o)

Waseda University graduate. Best known as the co-creator of [Code Geass](https://anilist.co/anime/1575/).

Most known for directing critically and commercially successful series, [Cowboy Bebop](https://anilist.co/anime/1/) and [Samurai Champloo](https://anilist.co/anime/205/).

He is noted for blending together multiple genres in his anime. For example, in Cowboy Bebop, classic cowboy western mixes with '60s/'70s New York City film noir, jazz/blues music, Hong Kong action movies, and to top it off the series is set in space. In his later work, Samurai Champloo, he unites the cultures of Okinawa, hip hop, modern-day Japan, and chanbara.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/山本沙代) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sayo_Yamamoto)

Renowed Anime Director, known for the critically acclaimed anime series [Michiko & Hatchin](https://anilist.co/anime/4087/Michiko-to-Hatchin/), [Lupin the Third: The Woman Called Fujiko Mine](https://anilist.co/anime/13203/Lupin-the-Third-Mine-Fujiko-to-Iu-Onna/) and [Yuri on Ice](https://anilist.co/anime/21709/Yuri-on-Ice/).

After graduating from the College of Art and Design in Tokyo she joined Studio Madhouse as Production Assistant. She had her directing debut at age 25 on [X](https://anilist.co/anime/156/X-TV/) after which she became freelance.

**Notable works outside anime:**
- Persona 5 (Video Game, 2016) (OP Director, Storyboard)

Originating from [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/). Went through [Gonzo](https://anilist.co/studio/3/) and [Shin-Ei](https://anilist.co/studio/247/) before going freelance. He is most known for his work on the first season of [One Punch Man](https://anilist.co/anime/21087/OnePunch-Man/). He is also the original creator of original anime [Sonny Boy](https://anilist.co/anime/132126/Sonny-Boy/).

Most known for directing critically and commercially successful series, [Cowboy Bebop](https://anilist.co/anime/1/) and [Samurai Champloo](https://anilist.co/anime/205/).

He is noted for blending together multiple genres in his anime. For example, in Cowboy Bebop, classic cowboy western mixes with '60s/'70s New York City film noir, jazz/blues music, Hong Kong action movies, and to top it off the series is set in space. In his later work, Samurai Champloo, he unites the cultures of Okinawa, hip hop, modern-day Japan, and chanbara.

[Twitter (AYMRC)](https://twitter.com/AYMRC) | [Instagram (aymeric_kevin)](https://www.instagram.com/aymeric_kevin/)

Kevin Aymeric is a French art director and background artist. In 2010, he graduated from *Gobelins* - a Parisian animation school. He was a co-director of two animated shorts, *Fenrir* and *Le Royaume* and designing the backgrounds for the video game *Rayman Legends*, which he gained some acclaim for. However, Aymeric is best known for his backgrounds on [Masaki Yuaasa](https://anilist.co/staff/100068/Masaaki-Yuasa)'s and [Eunyoung Choi](https://anilist.co/staff/115088/Eunyoung-Choi)'s projects. 

Aymeric's tendency towards vibrant, slightly warped urban locales was uniquely suited to the Yuasa School's direction. Thought he generally uses Photoshop for cleanly executed lineart in his backgrounds, Aymeric's backgrounds in Ping Pong The Animation were all hand drawn in pencil.

He worked as a concept artist at Riot Games in Los Angeles, but as per September 2019, he left. He now currently works as Production Designer at Sony Pictures Animation.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/e8144) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/eunyoung_tokyo)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/3and15) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/三原三千夫)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/3and15) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/三原三千夫)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/bahijd) | [Tumblr](http://bahijd.tumblr.com/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/bahijd)

Freelance animator from Austria who gained attraction on the internet thanks to his gif animations, which then served as a stepping stone for him joining the industry. Made his proper debut on [Shinichirou Watanabe](https://anilist.co/staff/97009/)'s adaptation of [Kids on the Slope](https://anilist.co/anime/12531/). His cuts are often heavily layered, exploiting the unique potential of digital processing.

**Notable works outside anime:**
- Skullgirls (Video Game, 2012) (Character and Effects Animation)
- Carpainter - Digital Harakiri (Music Album, 2015) (Cover Illustration)
- Death Stranding (Video Game, 2019) (Concept Art)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/binobinobi) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/押山清高)

Co-founder and Representative Director of [Studio Durian](https://anilist.co/studio/6283/).
